definition: Annual Percentage Rate; a standardized measure of the cost of credit including interest and certain finance charges, expressed as a yearly rate.
Loan-to-Value; loan amount ÷ property value (typically the lower of purchase price or appraised value).
Combined Loan-to-Value; total of all liens ÷ property value.
A common mortgage lending term used on the SAFE exam; know the definition, why it matters, and where it appears in the loan process.
TILA-RESPA Integrated Disclosure rule requiring the Loan Estimate and Closing Disclosure for most closed-end mortgages.
Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act; requires settlement disclosures and prohibits kickbacks/unearned fees (Section 8).
Truth in Lending Act; requires standardized disclosures of credit terms/costs (e.g., APR, finance charge).
Equal Credit Opportunity Act; prohibits discrimination in credit and requires certain notices (e.g., adverse action).
Home Mortgage Disclosure Act; requires data collection/reporting on mortgage applications and loans by covered institutions.
